intro: Boerlagella, commonly known as the "false broom" or "broom weed," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Boerlagella species are annual or perennial herbs, and they play a role in soil stabilization due to their extensive root systems. The genus is native to various regions in Africa, Asia, and Australia.
